title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős Problem #149: Strong Chromatic Index Conjecture**

Is χ'_s(G) ≤ (5/4)Δ² for all graphs G with max degree Δ?

**Status:** OPEN
**Best bound:** 1.772Δ² (Hurley-de Joannis de Verclos-Kang 2022)
**Conjectured:** (5/4)Δ² = 1.25Δ²
**Gap:** 0.522Δ²
mathContext: Strong edge coloring: edges at distance ≤ 2 get different colors. χ'_s(G) = χ(L(G)²).

title: Maximum Degree
content:
**maxDegree G:** The maximum degree Δ of any vertex in G.

maxDegree G = sup_{v ∈ V} deg(v)

The conjecture bounds χ'_s in terms of Δ².

title: Edges at Distance 2
content:
**edgesAtDistance2 G e₁ e₂:** Two edges are at distance ≤ 2 if:
- They share a vertex, OR
- Both touch a common third vertex

This defines which edge pairs must get different colors in strong coloring.

title: Strong Edge Coloring
content:
**StrongEdgeColoring G:** A coloring of edges where edges at distance ≤ 2 get different colors.

This is more restrictive than ordinary edge coloring (where only adjacent edges must differ).

title: Strong Chromatic Index
Line Graph
content:
**lineGraph G:** The line graph L(G) has:
- Vertices = edges of G
- Two vertices adjacent iff the corresponding edges share an endpoint

Strong edge coloring of G = proper vertex coloring of L(G)².

title: Erdős-Nešetřil Conjecture (1985)
content:
**ErdosNesetrilConjecture:**

For all graphs G with max degree Δ: χ'_s(G) ≤ (5/4)Δ²

This is the main open problem. If true, it would be tight (achieved by C₅ blow-up).

title: Tightness: C₅ Blow-up
content:
**conjecture_is_tight:**

The C₅ blow-up (replace each vertex of C₅ with Δ/2 vertices) achieves exactly (5/4)Δ².

This shows if the conjecture is true, the bound cannot be improved.

title: Trivial Bound
content:
**trivial_bound:**

χ'_s(G) ≤ 2Δ² - 2Δ + 1 ≈ 2Δ²

Each edge has at most 2(Δ-1) neighbors at distance 1 from each endpoint. Greedy coloring gives this bound.

title: Molloy-Reed (1997)
content:
**molloy_reed_1997:**

χ'_s(G) ≤ 1.998Δ² for large Δ.

First to break the factor-2 barrier! Uses the probabilistic method with Lovász Local Lemma.

title: Bruhn-Joos (2018)
content:
**bruhn_joos_2018:**

χ'_s(G) ≤ 1.93Δ² for large Δ.

Improved the constant using refined probabilistic techniques.

title: Bonamy-Perrett-Postle (2022)
content:
**bonamy_perrett_postle_2022:**

χ'_s(G) ≤ 1.835Δ² for large Δ.

Used new techniques for coloring graphs with sparse neighborhoods.

title: Hurley-de Joannis de Verclos-Kang (2022)
content:
**hurley_joannis_kang_2022:**

χ'_s(G) ≤ 1.772Δ² for large Δ.

**Current best bound!** Uses entropy compression and improved local density analysis.

title: The Remaining Gap
content:
**current_gap:**

1.772 - 1.25 = 0.522

The gap between best known bound and conjecture is still significant (about 42% of the conjectured bound).

title: C₄-free Graphs (Mahdian)
content:
**mahdian_c4_free:**

For C₄-free graphs: χ'_s(G) ≤ (2+o(1))Δ²/log Δ

Much better than general graphs! The absence of 4-cycles allows significant improvement.

title: Clique Number of L(G)²
content:
**cliqueNumber_LineSquare:**

ω(L(G)²) = largest clique in the square of the line graph.

Since χ(H) ≥ ω(H), bounding ω(L(G)²) is a weaker problem than the full conjecture.

Even ω(L(G)²) ≤ (5/4)Δ² is open for general graphs!

title: Chung-Gyárfás-Tuza-Trotter (1990)
content:
**chung_gyarfas_tuza_trotter_1990:**

If |E(G)| ≥ (5/4)Δ², then G has two strongly independent edges.

This is the 'easier' version of the problem that Erdős-Nešetřil also asked. It was solved in 1990.

title: Induced Matching
content:
**IsInducedMatching G M:**

A set M of edges is an induced matching if all pairs are strongly independent (no two edges at distance ≤ 2).

χ'_s(G) = minimum number of induced matchings partitioning E(G).

title: Summary
content:
**strong_chromatic_bounds_summary:**

Progress timeline:
- Trivial: ≤ 2Δ²
- Molloy-Reed (1997): ≤ 1.998Δ²
- Bruhn-Joos (2018): ≤ 1.93Δ²
- Bonamy-Perrett-Postle (2022): ≤ 1.835Δ²
- Hurley et al. (2022): ≤ 1.772Δ²
- Conjecture: ≤ 1.25Δ²
- Lower bound: (5/4)Δ² achievable

title: Main Status
content:
**erdos_149:**

Erdős Problem #149: Strong Chromatic Index Conjecture - OPEN

The gap between 1.772Δ² and (5/4)Δ² remains one of the major open problems in graph coloring theory.
